title: Good food and service
text: Went in for a late lunch. Had a home made Steak and Ale Pie with veg and mash. Came very quickly and was well cooked and hot. I also had a white wine and soda. The staff were friendly. The pub was pretty bulk standard. If in the area again would use again. Covid compliant.

title: A hidden gem
text: I had never heard of Gilbert White so thought I would give it a try. Its a lovely museum that you think is going to be tiny but is actually quite large. Be aware the house is not good for wheelchairs but the gardens are mostly accessible. The grounds are big with signposted (not big signs tho) and would be great for picnics (lots of seating). Covid compliant. Friendly staff. Nice looking shop and cafe which I didn’t use.

title: A little Gem
text: Despite the rain it was lovely to visit. The gardens were lovely and well maintained. Even in the Autumn there is lots to interest especially all the unusual trees. The tea room was lovely and the food good. Staff friendly. The Covid one way system worked. If using a wheelchair you will have very few problem areas.

title: Lovely little museum
text: A great start being greeted by Mr Bennett then the talk about Jane by Mr Knightley. Very informative and entertaining! Well set up displays and films throughout. Just wish the tea room had been open
place: The Jane Austen Centre Skip-the-line Ticket in Bath

title: You can feel the history
text: Love the way this is set up. Audio guide really useful. You are in some places walking where the Romans walked. Reasonable price for a larger exhibit than I thought. Helpful staff. Good Covid preparations in keeping with the history.

title: Good even on a wet day
text: A lovely area just down from Royal Crescent. Has a great play area specially for kids. The Botanic Garden well signposted and must look lovely in summer tho some still flowering now. Nice memorial to Queen Victoria

title: Had lunch here and it was
text: Had lunch here and it was a great place to eat. Being a Thurs it was quiet but they are coping with Covid changes well. Plenty of carpark space and there is a big outdoor eating area that kids can roam in. Service prompt and friendly. All comments about food from all 4 of us was that it was presented well, cooked well and apprropriately priced. Its not a posh place but the food was well worth the visit!

title: Sunday lunch
text: Very good place for all sorts of groups of folks. We had 19! Would make a good local. Advise booking on weekends. Lovely staff!

title: Great for special occasion
text: Had a 100th birthday in the Fountain Suite. Afternoon tea for 30. Setting great. Food was lovely. Lots of it as well including home made sausage rolls. Never ending tea and coffee too.Staff very helpful.

title: Really nice Marstons hotel.
text: Really nice Marstons hotel. Room was nice , clean and well stocked. Helpful staff. Great have bath as well as shower over. Breakfast separate but very good value. Meals and drinks generally reasonable prices and good quality. Some of the rooms are in a separate block but only short walk from main building. Plenty of parking. Special spaces for charging electric cars.

title: Nice varied museum
text:
This is a great little museum which it was nice to see was run by the military. Very helpful.
Nice little basic cafe in basement. Toilets on same level.
Enjoyed my rainy day visit there.

title: In the foot steps of history!
text:
Loved visiting this as had always been on my bucket list and it didn’t disappoint. They are doing lots of renovation so there is scaffolding everywhere.
Be aware there is quite a lot of walking and in places its steepish.
By the way get the all round €30 ticket and visit the other places too like Agora (in fact especially in Summer go to one of the other sites first as the queue to get ticket will be shorter).
I have the museum (not included) a miss this time but intend to come back so will do that then.

title: More like a UK 3 star
text:
This hotel is a bit tired and the room I had needed updating especially the shower area especially the shower head.

It has a 24/7 check in which was great as my flight was late and I got there at 02:30. Member of staff was polite and helpful. Don’t forget you will need to pay €3 per room per night city tax on arrival.

That being said I have to say that room was a good size and very clean. It was serviced every day. If you can choose a room ask for one on the outside of the building as my view was a fire escape...

You can’t access the roof at mo as they are working on 5th floor rooms. Pity about not getting pic of Acropolis at night from there :(

The breakfast was a buffet which was fine as you could have as much as you like. I took tea bags back to my room as two is not enough, even for a solo traveller, if you don’t drink coffee.

I didnt try the hotel dinner buffet as there are plenty of places to eat in Athens.

There is a metro station about 10mins away that takes you to Syntagema Square right at centre which is terminus for all transport.

Would use again but just be aware it’s not usual Best Western posh standard.

title: Updated heritage hotel
text:
An old fashioned beach holiday hotel that’s been sympathetically done up to modern standards. I loved the squeaky floors and stairs tho not everyone will. Nicely off the beaten track if you want that.
Room had all you could need and my second floor corner room tho facing the (not very busy) road was nice and quiet. Didn’t try the food but it is no doubt reasonable hotel standard. There is a small separate bar as well which I didn’t use either.
The view from the other side of the hotel is splendid.
Good car parking tho may need to drop disabled passengers at front door as there is a bit of a slope.
Looks a good place for conferences.

title: Bargain with a wowcher
text:
Check in/out very efficient. We booked a 2 night stay with breakfast and dinner for one of nights and it was well worth the money. Requested and got a twin room which was huge as it had a seating area. Good amenities in the room. Bathroom had spa bath (unfortunately didn’t work) with shower over. The shower was a bit of pain as it wasn’t adjustable. Room was quiet as in corner. The room was very clean and seemed modern.
Used the included in deal spa area. Nice clean pool, sauna and steam room. Didn’t use weights or cardio rooms but looked OK. I had a facial which was lovely. Be aware the treatments are separate as the lady is a separate business.
Restaurant food was great. Well cooked, hot and arranged nicely for the dinner. The breakfast buffet was varied and hot. Standard is scrambled eggs but can request poached or fried alternative.
All in all the staff were all friendly and helpful.

title: Old fashioned pub
text: 300 year old pub that has been left old fashioned but in a good way. The theme is racing and there is memorabilia in abundance but over the top. Loved the wooden floor and the real fire! The food is basic but homemade, tasty, hot and plentiful. Quite a few ales on pump. Staff very friendly and helpful.

title: Tucked away gem
text: Only had a couple of teas but it’s a lovely old fashioned family run place. Very friendly helpful staff and the food looked good. Tucked away down an alley near the castle so ideal for coffee/tea n cake time, lunch or dinner.

title: Yummy food
text: Old fashioned look but modern methods. This tea room has a nice variety for snacks and light lunches. China cup and saucer with tea pot. Food well cooked and came quickly. Staff very friendly. Will be back.

title: Ideal for adults and kids
text: Good way of learning about Norman history in way engaging to children and adults. There are also animals that be fed. Nice little cafe with reasonable prices. Difficult access for the disabled as slope reasonably to but not impossible. Good day out.

title: Good food place
text: Went on recommendation and wasn’t disappointed with the food-reasonably priced, well cooked and plenty of it for price; atmosphere wide open space with bright but not glaring light. Service was good friendly and quick. Would have given it a 5* had they not added a huge service charge-tipping should be optional at ALL restaurants (they would have got one but not 12.5%!).

title: Excellent small museum
text: It’s free! You can make a donation but no pressure. It’s not huge but well worth the visit! Good use of tablets etc to give info about exhibits. Loved the boat shed too. Cafe looked nice and the food looked good too!

title: Yummy all day breakfast
text: This is a place the locals obviously go to to meet friends and family. The breakfast was huge ($NZ25 so needed to be) and delicious. Loved the creamed and the poached eggs done just right (you can choose how to have your eggs). Comfy and vibe with a friendly vibe.

title: Easy delightful walk
text: This is great for those who can’t do the challenging peak walk. Fairly flat well kept track with plenty of places to stop and just chill. Loved it!

title: Good impulse stop
text: Lovely place for stopping. Food and drink is reasonably priced for good size portions. Staff were friendly and polite. Lovely view and well decorated in Art Deco style.

title: A little gem
text: Great place to meet friends half way between Hastings and Napier. Food is great and very tasty. The prices are reasonable. No wonder it’s so popular!

title: Some rooms better than others
text: The hotel is mostly quite modern and looks smart but don’t get put in some of the rooms in the 800s as they are a lot smaller. The staff are friendly and helpful and the food is good. Prices for food and drink are reasonable. Kilburnie is a bit away (but only a little) from the centre it’s quieter traffic wise etc. Ideal for short stays.

title: Edwardian villa ideal for couples and singles
text: John was really friendly and helpful throughout my stay. The room wasn’t huge but had everything needed (I have had smaller rooms in London for more expense). With a comfy bed and was lovely and warm as the heater had been on well before my arrival. Breakfast was cereals (5/6 different ones), toast, juice and hot drinks as much as you like with facilities to cook up 9.30pm if you like. The daily copy of the Dominion Post was a nice touch. Parking is by coupon (you lose the space but you can park in the resident parking with it), Not far to walk to Te Papa In one direction or The Basin in the other. It’s not flashy or modern but I would visit there again.

title: Every visitor should go
text: The Memorial with the new carillion bells installed (3.5 years in the making) with the tomb of the unknown soldier is fab then you have other memorials in front including a new French one. Up from there is the Museum. I did both the Great War (you can just self tour for free) and Trenches tours which were awesome then had a look at the free ANZAC displays. All very informative and enlightening. If I had had time I would pay to see it all again.

title: Went only to see the giants
text:
I had been before and enjoyed it very much but this time was only there for the 1914-1918 display. It exceeded my expectation. Thanks to Weta workshops for the awesome giants who were representatives of Kiwis in that war. Likes the commemoration at the end where you could write on then make up a paper poppy to add.

Had lunch in the cafe. The food, drink and service was good. Prices not excessive.

Nice stuff in the gift shop too.
place: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa

title: Better than McDonalds next door
text: This visit as good as previous. Family run feel with friendly staff. It wasn’t overwhelmingly busy but there were lots of locals there... Food quick arriving, well presented and hot. Got a pot of tea and when I didn’t want milk happily gave extra hot water. Free Wi-fi for 2 hours. Toilets were clean which is always a good guide. Love the pics of the charities n teams they support.

title: A bit of Pukekohe history
text: This is a cute little place that was moved from a nearby ‘village’ called Bombay. Very informative personalised enthusiastic tour. A little gem. Only open at specific times but can do special opening

title: Family run feel
text: Popped in to here to meet a friend. Maxine and her staff were very friendly and efficient. The prices were very cheap but the food was very good quality. Well worth the visit!

title: Cheap overnighter
text: Don’t expect 4 star but for the price it was fine. Getting from airport was easy (go out of door six, find the big yellow bus stop and show the driver your booking and it will be free and drops off at the door). The checkin was efficient both key and breakfast voucher were ready. The room, bathroom and bedding was clean (carpet was stained in one place but clean of loose stuff). It needs some of the woodwork replacing. My room had 3 singles in it and there were extra blankets n pillows in cupboard. Enough coffee/tea bags and cups. Bathroom bits were fine and water nice n hot. Only problem was Wi-fi wasn’t working nor was the Sky when I arrived or left. Breakfast was an eat/drink all you like but very bland. Filled a hole though. Checkout was efficient too. Didn’t need transport back to airport but they asked.

title: Ideal for Eurostar
text:
Stayed overnight before catching a Eurostar so it was an ideal location for that. Good value too if you stick to a dorm room. The check in was easy and the staff were very friendly.

The dorm room was full but not overcrowded. It was great being in an en-suite one too rather than having to trog through the corridors. If you have difficulty getting up to top bunk you might prefer to have a single room (or perhaps ask if you can check for a room with a bottom level bunk empty) as the ladders are quite steep. Nice to have not only a plug but also a couple of USB points (well most people have phone+tablet nowadays so makes sense.

The communal areas looked fine though I didnt have time to use them but I was disappointed by the lack of a self catering kitchen even if it had only had a kettle some mugs and tea spoons plus a toaster.

Being London its not the quietest of places but it was from outside the hostel so beyond their control.

title: Good base at reasonable price
text: Room was great. Mine was an upgrade so a bit bigger. Very clean. The staff were friendly and welcoming. Enjoyed the breakfast which was varied and topped up regularly. All hot stuff was hot and cold cold! Easy check in and out.

title: Dog friendly ++
text: Met here as half way between my sisters and mine and it was an ideal choice. Wish I had taken dog as not only do they accept them they have a special menu! Decor was lovely. Food was great. Not the cheapest but would rather pay that bit more so no more as it’s not a lot more. Staff welcoming, helpful and friendly. Happy to go there again!

title: Enjoyed my visit
text: I was using a Groupon but even without the prices were good. Nice varied menu which changes regularly. Food was well cooked with plenty of it. Liked the decor which was quite homely.

title: Old world with modern touches
text: A very old coaching inn that has been updated and extended sympathetically. Great to see they are dog friendly. Had a nice sized twin room with a shower only ensuite. Provided kettle etc, iron and ironing board. Comfy bed. Carpet was a bit stained from tea/coffee and for some reason, despite them providing new batteries, the tv remote didn’t work but otherwise no grouches!

title: Would happily go there again
text: This seems the place to go for a drink and food in Ripley (there was a queue the morning we went). Plenty of space on ground floor, upstairs and in the sheltered courtyard. Dog friendly upstairs and outside. Food and drink came quickly and well presented. A little gem.

title: CWGC visit
text: This is one of the larger UK cemeteries maintained by CWGC. It’s well manicured but not overly so. Graves from different nations. Oasis of calm and reflection

title: Meal at lunchtime
text: Ixworth is an old fashioned place and this is an old fashioned place to eat but that suited us just fine. The menu at lunch was not extensive but came out well cooked and hot with reasonable portion sizes for the £8.99 for 2 courses. Drink prices reasonable too. Lovely to see a real open fire. Will return to try an evening meal soon :)

title: Food and Ambience good
text: Nice to find a dog friendly pub. Very busy on Sat night but didn't rush us. Food was good and reasonably priced. Drink prices a tad expensive. Lovely old fashioned pub with friendly staff.

title: Tales from the past
text: Tickets are available on the day from the cafe. Tours of tunnel are at 11am and 2pm and well worth the £5 fee. Niall was both entertaining and informative! Car park is free. Only Cafe in open from 9am to 5pm the park area is open 24/7. Well restored and kept grounds. Floor in tunnels is uneven so awkward for disabled but could do in wheelchair if pushed by strong person same with ground tho paths are more even. Toilet in cafe inc for disabled.

title: £24 is not expensive as the ticket lasts for a year
text: You need a whole day to do this properly. You can get there by car but you can also uses the Medway hop on/off bus (£3.75 all day for adults/£2.50 concessions) if staying in Chatham/Gillingham/Rochester. Once you get in the exhibits are free (except for the Call the Midwife tour which is only available online) and some are timed tours Lots of hands on stuff for kids as well as interest for adults plus two children's play areas. There is a restaurant and shop at the entrance plus another cafe in the train shed. All the staff friendly and helpful. The parts that they salvaged from the Namur (the what I hear you ask but I will let you find out plus clambering through a sub were my faves for this trip but will have to come back to see more

title: Good food in a good venue
text: I got there at 8:30pm and they were still able to accommodate me for food phew. The prices were reasonable and food when it came was well cooked and tasty. No frozen stuff here! It's a lovely old 14th century Inn that they haven't spoilt by doing up too much. It was busy but not busy and everyone was friendly.

title: Loved all the Pooh Memorabila
text: I didn't realise that Hartfield was the home of Pooh but this little place put that right. It's a shop, cafe and info centre rolled into one. I got a lovely waterproof leaflet that told me how to get to Pooh Bridge and they had it in other languages. There is a little bit of road parking outside but you might have to park further into village and walk up. The food was good and dogs are welcome in the outside seating area. If you love Winnie the Pooh please take yourself here!

title: Lovely gardens
text: The gardens of this National Trust property were lovely as were the woodlands but better signposting (or more frequent in the case of the woodlands) would be helpful. The house was lovely too. Pity I couldn't take the dog into the outside part of the cafe area because it was inside the no dogs zone else I would have given a five!

title: A little gem
text: A friend suggested visiting here and am glad he did. There is memorabilia and stories from the Gelderland. They have a lovely film in Dutch with English subtitles with stories from Dutch folk of some of the crashes. Good car parking and welcoming staff!

title: Lovely place to rest your head
text:
This was a last minute booking which a friend arranged but we were very happy with.
The house is dated but very comfortable as it is also the owners home. The beds were comfortable and we were given the room with a huge ensuite that would be suitable for disable though not too disable as there is a step down into the shower (there is a separate bath with shower over too. The wifi was a little sensitive but it may have been my phone but it was free... The breakfast was huge and they gave you a little bag etc so you could make a lunch to take away. No parking but you can park on the road for free. Its a fairly busy road during the day but once dark falls its much quieter. Heard nothing during the night. Use of sitting room with big tv (owners have their own). Would use again for 80 euros per couple.

title: Great overnight stay
text:
I picked this because it was near to Soesterberg Museum and wasn't too pricy. Got a special deal as I am registered with Accor but even without the discount it would have been cheap.
Its right in the centre of Amersfoort but there is ample parking underneath the hotel. Better directions on how to get there would be good (even on their own website!) It costs 5 euros for parking which is a bargain...
The room was nice and spacious with all the usual requirements plus a little fridge if you are staying for more than a night. We had a room which could be either a double or a twin. Lovely shower with two shower options - rainfall or hand.
Staff were lovely and very helpful including the owner who we met on way out.
The bar area was great and they did a limited menu which is the same as the room service one. Be aware that there is also an all you can eat buffet place on the same floor so be sure to go to the right one. The all you can eat place also has an a la carte. if you want to explore the staff are happy to advise on ideal places.
Only 45mins into Amsterdam from the train station and if flying in you can get to direct to Amerfoort from Schiphol. Trains about every half hour during the day...

All in all a credit to Mercure.

title: Huge museum that has a bit of everything
text:
This great museum is on what used to be the Soesterberg Air Field. The building is huge but there are also activities outside. There is a nice little restaurant that you can visit with out entering the actual museum and even take your meal outside. Many people were having their packed lunches outside. Staff friendly and welcoming.
Will have to go back again because two hours was just not enough. 12.50 euros per adult is not expensive for how long you can stay.

title: Good Off Airport overnight Stay
text:
This is a good place to stay if you get in late from a flight and don't want to go far or are catching a flight out next day. Its reasonably priced for what it offers.
The free shuttle was great and the driver was very friendly.
The check in was OK but not helped by the poor over night receptionist (we got there about 23:30) being the only one and also being the barman. Might be worth having 2 on till at leave 1am. I would have given a 5 if it hadn't been for that.
The room was ideal and had all we could want for our stay.
The breakfast was great and there was a good variety. Bar prices weren't too bad for a hotel and there were plenty of comfy chairs.

title: Good place to catch up
text:
Went on the recommendation of friends daughter and was certainly worth the trip into the countryside. Large beer garden at back and for those with kids it has a miniature railway they could ride on. Dogs not allowed in the beer garden but they had 4 tables at front they were allowed in. Good large car park which even though very busy was not full.
Food is very homemade-no frozen scampi here! Generous tasty portions. Service was quick with plenty of friendly, helpful staff on. Good variety of drinks including 2 real ales. Prices were reasonable too.
Toilets were clean and they had a downstairs one for disabled/baby hanging (would have been a five if they had been separate).
If every in Dunstable area would certainly use again..

title: Relaxed value for military folk
text:
Have stayed here twice now and will do so. You get top class hotel service for military prices.
I had a comfortable single room on 5th Floor with no ensuite (but they were only a step away and there were plenty of them). You can book rooms with an en-suite if you need one. Everything was clean and the bed was comfy. No aircon but there was a lovely fan. Tea and coffee making facilities plus iron (wish it had had steam) and ironing board) plus 1 large&2 small towels.

The breakfast was a never-ending, varied and well cooked buffet and the staff circulated with fresh tea/coffee. Price was very reasonable.

Staff were very helpful.

Bonus-they have 2 changing rooms but have had to check out or not checked in you can use that. There is a shoe polish machine there and the luggage room is right next to it

title: Lovely place to visit
text: This is one of the places I went back to Malta to visit and it was well worth it. Took 74 bus from Valletta Centre. Be aware the buses stop early getting back so go in the morning. Plenty of the brightly painted boats doing the trips with 9 people on boat (if you get sea sick easily go on a very flat calm day - not many of those on windy Malta). The trip takes about 30mins. The little caves have stunning blue water. For €7 per adult was worth it.

title: Lovely meal
text: Lovely sitting up high just looking at sun and sea and the little boats going back and forth. Staff very friend. Nice varied menu and when order arrived it was well cooked, tasty and a good quantity. Both food and drink reasonably priced.

title: Cheap n cheerful
text: Don't expect luxury but the price is cheap for what it is. There is a lift to get you up to the rooms but there are 3 steps into building Si limited for able disabled. We had an apartment with 3 single beds in. Beds comfortable and bedding clean but only one pillow with no extras. The kitchenette was basic but there was a kettle and a little table top oven with 2 ring job. There was also a good full size fridge. Plenty of cutlery and crockery and pans for basic meals (we only did breakfast). They provide a tea towel but no cleaning clothes or washing up liquid so you will need to buy them. There is a little shop with a good variety of supplies about 5 mins walk away plus a newsagent and pharmacy. Plenty of bars and restaurants. Be aware if you are a light sleeper this is not the place for as some of the bars are loud and and finish late. 10 mins walk down to rocky but nice shoreline area. Nice to have a little balcony with table and chairs on it. Bathroom is basic and in the room we had you had to hold the shower but you could have a bath. Plenty of hot water. We didn't need it but there is both fan and zircon. Keys are collected and dropped off from the the Blue Skies St George Hotel just across the road. The Malta Transfer drops off and picks up just outside the St George.

title: Cafe and shop
text: The food is good on premises quality and reasonably priced. The staff were friendly and helpful. The money goes back into the Trust which is a charity.

title: Turkish dramatics
text: Wow this is somewhere to go if you want a restaurant with a difference. It's crammed full of stuff with little alcoves and balconies with banquette seating and tables of different styles. The food was secondary but that being said we all had the set meal and the food was good, the wine drinkable (we had the house wine) with friendly polite service. Would happily go again with other friends.

title: Good budget hotel
text:
It's registered as a 4 star but I would say it's a very good 3 star. Out of Centre with a 10min (for young and healthy) from metro. Quiet street right next to university. Not sure about parking. Steps down to main entrance but the restaurant next door had a slope so for disabled access that's a tick. No step up into hotel either. There are some disabled fitted rooms on ground floor (in fact we had a twin one where the bathroom was same size of the bedroom). Shower had plenty of hot water but not much pressure. Towels and bedding changed each day.
As usual in European places no tea/coffee making in rooms but the bar/reception is open 24/7 if you need a drink. Breakfast was a nice varied eat as much as you like buffet.
Staff friendly and helpful.
Don't forget you will have to pay city tax which is €6 per person per night on top of your room fees.
